Resource Conflicts: If projects aren't aligned, you might end up with multiple projects competing for the same resources (people, budget, equipment) at the same time. This can lead to delays, cost overruns, and overall inefficiency.

Which statements about quality assurance and project assurance are CORRECT?
1. They are both independent of the project manager
2. They are both the responsibility of the project board
3. They are both independent from the project management team
4. They both assure that applicable standards are being used

discussion.content: Its D (1,4)
D is correct - Statement 3 is not right because they are not both independent from PMT - Project assurance is by PB which is part of PMT

Selected Answer: D
It is D

Selected Answer: D
I would also say D

Selected Answer: D
Option 1 is definitely correct. And 4 is a better option than 3

Selected Answer: D
Quality Assurance
This is like Project Assurance but the focus is on Quality in the organization and not just quality related to the project. It is to make sure that the planned Quality activities are done.

Provides a way to get an independent review of the Quality process;
Checks to see that it complies with company Quality standards; and
Ensures that Quality processes are in place.
Project Assurance is the responsibility of the Project Board, while the Corporate or Programme Management is responsible for Quality Assurance. You can also say that the role Quality Assurance is outside the project management team while Project Assurance is within the project management team

questions.question_text: Which is a minimum requirement for applying the business case theme?

discussion.content: This answer is C - define the management actions that will be put in place to ensure that the project's outcomes are achieved and confirm that the project's benefits are realised

Selected Answer: C
C. To define the actions required to confirm the project's benefits are realized

The Business Case theme in PRINCE2 focuses on ensuring that the project remains viable and aligned with its objectives. A minimum requirement for applying this theme is to define the actions needed to confirm that the project's benefits are realized. This ensures that the project delivers value and justifies the investment. The other options (A, B, and D) are related to monitoring and reporting but are not the minimum requirement for applying the Business Case theme.
